required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Primary Immunodeficiencies in Costa Rican Adults
clinical_study.official_title: CASE SERIES OF PRIMARY IMMUNODEFICIENCIES IN ADULTS DIAGNOSED IN TWO HOSPITALS OF THE TERTIARY LEVEL OF CARE OF THE COSTA RICAN SOCIAL SECURITY Fund, 2017-2018

brief_summary.textblock: Primary immunodeficiencies represent a underdiagnosed group of rare diseases which if diagnosed well and in time can be treated in an efficient manner and prevent complications that may affect the quality of patients life in an severe manner. Neither in Costa Rica nor in Central America studies or national registries regarding the prevalence and characterization of primary immunodeficiencies in adult patients exist up to now. This study reflects for the first time the epidemiologic situation of primary immunodeficiencies in a Central American country, characterizing adult patients diagnosed with primary and idiopathic immune disorders treated in two specialized immunodeficiency clinics in Costa Rica.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical manifestations of all adult patients diagnosed with primary and idiopathic immune defects
primary_outcome.description: Describe the clinical manifestations of all adult patients diagnosed with primary and idiopathic immune defects attended in the primary immunodeficiency clinics of the Hospitals Mexico and Dr. Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia during the study period.

secondary_outcome.description: Characterize immunodeficient patients using sociodemographic and health variables.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concordances between clinical manifestations and literature
secondary_outcome.description: •Establish concordances between the clinical manifestations of the group of patients under study with those described in the literature according to the different pathologies.
Record organic complications secondary to immunodeficiency status.
Differentiate the type and degree of immunodeficiency of each patient.
Report isolated pathogens that cause infectious manifestations in patients.
•Report the colonizing bacteria present in the cultures of the upper airways of the patients requested in the initial approach.

study_pop.textblock: All cases of primary immunodeficiency and idiopathic defects of immunity detected in the primary immunodeficiency clinics of the Hospitals Mexico and Dr. Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia between November 2017 and May 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients from adult primary immunodeficiency clinics will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with HIV
- Proven secondary immunodeficiencies.
